Others: JJ Redick praised Quincy Olivari for his exceptional effort in the Lakersâ€™ 107-102 win against the Milwaukee Bucks on Thursday.
Quincy Olivari, an undrafted player, seized the moment in the fourth quarter, hitting crucial shots, showcasing his relentless full-court defense, and hustle.
Olivari scored 11 points on 4-of-6 shooting, including 3-of-6 from 3-point range, grabbed five rebounds, and handed out two assists in just 9 minutes and 24 seconds of play.
LeBron James contributed 11 points, six rebounds, and four assists in 16 minutes of action, exclusively in the first half.
The Lakers kept Anthony Davis on the court for additional minutes, while James remained on the bench.
The Lakers kept the game close and eventually took the lead after a 9-2 scoring run.
The Bucks' bench squad surged to a 15-point lead at the start of the final quarter, but the Lakers' bench fought back, cutting the deficit to six.
Quincy Olivari and Maxwell Lewis knocked down 3-pointers, energizing the Lakers' scoring run and helping them regain the lead by two points.
The Lakers' scoring spree reached 20 unanswered points before the Bucks finally broke the drought.
Olivari's explosive performance in the fourth quarter took center stage as he led the offense and carried the team.
LeBron James gave a shoutout to Quincy Olivari after his impressive showing in the win.
The Lakers' next preseason matchup is Tuesday against the Golden State Warriors at 7:00 PM PT.
